news.title: Centre approves 11.56 km metro extension from Noida sector 142 to Botanical Garden
news.para: The Aqua Line Metro will extend from Botanical Garden to Noida Sector 142. This new 11.56 km stretch will add eight stations. The project is sanctioned at Rs 2,254.35 crore and aims for completion in four years. This extension will boost connectivity between Noida, Greater Noida, and Delhi. It will also improve access to IGI Airport and major railway stations.

news.title: NCLAT to hear appeal against Oberoi Realty-led consortium's ₹919crore bid for Hotel Horizon
news.para: On February 25, 2026, the National Company Law Appellate Tribunal will deliberate on an appeal disputing the endorsement of Oberoi Realty's Rs 919 crore offer for Hotel Horizon. The tribunal has mandated that no equity should be allocated to those who successfully resolved the matter. Notably, the hotel's former promoters argue that the resolution was built on misleading financial data.

news.title: Sai Ishwari homebuyers in Mapusa file cheating complaint against two developers
news.para: Nine homebuyers have filed a cheating complaint against two real estate developers in Mapusa, Goa, for failing to deliver flats booked nearly a decade ago. Despite full payment for the 'Sai Ishwari' project, buyers allege false assurances and significant mental and financial distress. They also seek a probe into the cooperative credit society's loan sanction for the mortgaged project.

news.title: Gujarat appoints Uday Kotak as chairman of GIFT city
news.para: Uday Kotak has taken the helm as chairman of GIFT City, succeeding Hasmukh Adhia. With the vision of making this economic zone a draw for global capital, the Indian government has recently extended tax incentives, offering a 20-year tax holiday for enterprises operating there.

news.title: Mega e-auction for commercial plots across Uttar Pradesh
news.para: Uttar Pradesh State Industrial Development Authority is holding a major e-auction for industrial and commercial plots. This initiative aims to accelerate industrial growth across the state. Investors can bid for plots in various locations. The transparent online process offers opportunities for businesses. This move supports the vision of a USD 1 trillion economy for Uttar Pradesh.

news.title: Single women struggle to find rental homes in Chennai
news.para: Women renters in Chennai encounter moral scrutiny and broker harassment. Despite market shifts and proptech solutions, many face restrictive rules. Data shows a rise in women seeking rentals, preferring safer, managed communities. These areas command higher rents. Shared living in larger apartments is also becoming popular among women.

news.title: DDA’s notice to re-acquire 123 disputed land plots in South Delhi
news.para: The Delhi Development Authority (DDA) will re-acquire 123 land parcels in South Delhi villages following Supreme Court directives. This move aims to prevent unsuspecting buyers from purchasing disputed plots. The DDA has uploaded details of these parcels, originally acquired in the 1980s, on its website and cautioned the public against any transactions.

news.title: Uttar Pradesh clears policy to redevelop buildings older than 25 years
news.para: The UP government has introduced the Urban Redevelopment Policy, 2026, to address unsafe buildings and urban decay. This policy provides a framework for redeveloping old public and private housing and defunct industrial units, aiming to expedite stalled projects and promote efficient land use.

news.title: SC ends seven-year housing dispute, upholds ₹1.82 crore compensation for homebuyer
news.para: A seven-year legal battle concluded as the Supreme Court dismissed a Special Leave Petition from Keyana Estate, an associate of Kalpataru Group. Homebuyer Paresh Parihar will receive approximately Rs 1.82 crore in interest for delayed possession of his Goregaon flat, which he received in January 2024 after booking in 2013.

news.title: Enforcement directorate calls Jaypee Infratech homebuyers in money laundering probe
news.para: The Enforcement Directorate has summoned Jaypee Infratech Ltd homebuyers. This is part of a money laundering investigation. The probe is looking into alleged fund diversion under the company's insolvency resolution plan. Homebuyers are asked to submit project status reports and give statements. Delhi Police's Economic Offences Wing is also investigating.

news.title: Slum rehabilitation authority into claims of irregularities in Dharavi redevelopment project
news.para: An SRA investigation is underway following allegations of demolished huts being re-erected and ineligible occupants being declared eligible for free housing under the Dharavi Redevelopment Project. Activists claim connivance with DRP officials, citing repeated hut numbers and recent occupants receiving tenements.

news.title: China's new home prices extend decline as weak demand hounds sector
news.para: In January, China's real estate sector showed no signs of recovery, with new home prices continuing their decline. Government initiatives aimed at revitalizing the market have yet to yield results, leaving developers in a tight spot as buyer demand remains muted. While the potential for recovery exists, significant hurdles, such as high inventory levels in lesser-known cities, still loom large.

news.title: Homebuyers' body FPCE says many state real estate regulators not publishing annual reports
news.para: Many state RERA authorities are failing to publish annual reports. This non-compliance with the Real Estate Act hinders homebuyers' ability to assess system credibility. It also impacts governments' policy formulation. FPCE urges the Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs to issue fresh directives.

news.title: RBI plans to allow banks to lend to REITs from July 1; sets 10% exposure cap
news.para: The Reserve Bank of India is proposing new rules for banks lending to Real Estate Investment Trusts. These directions, set to begin in July 2026, include limits on how much banks can lend. Banks will need board approval and REITs must meet certain operational and financial criteria. This move aims to broaden financing options for the real estate sector.

news.title: Lodha Developers ex-director remanded to ED custody till February 20 in money laundering case
news.para: A former director of Lodha Developers, Rajendra Lodha, has been remanded to Enforcement Directorate custody. The case involves alleged money laundering amounting to Rs 85 crore. Lodha is accused of orchestrating unauthorized transactions, diverting company funds, and causing substantial wrongful loss.

news.title: Centre calls for integrated urban planning, wider credit access to meet rising housing demand
news.para: India's urban population is set to surge, demanding more affordable housing and infrastructure. Union minister Manohar Lal stressed the need for collaboration between policymakers, financial institutions, and urban planners. Innovative solutions like a national housing exchange and transit-oriented development are proposed.

news.title: Civil aviation ministry studying relaxation of height norms for real estate projects
news.para: The government is exploring relaxing building height limits to boost city development. This move aims to facilitate vertical growth as land becomes scarce. India's real estate market is projected for significant expansion. The civil aviation minister highlighted this potential. More airports are also planned, which will positively impact construction and housing sectors.

news.title: Trichy’s luxury flat boom finds ready buyers
news.para: Trichy's real estate market is experiencing a boom, with premium flat prices soaring to over Rs 1.5 crore, surpassing some Chennai areas. This surge is attributed to infrastructure development and increased demand for larger, amenity-rich homes. Developers anticipate further growth with upcoming tech parks and hospitals.

news.title: Bhubaneswar: Residents accuse developer of encroaching upon common road
news.para: Residents of a GGP Colony housing project are accusing their developer of encroaching on common roads for a new project, causing safety hazards. They also claim the developer has occupied common areas within their complex for unauthorized commercial use. Despite multiple complaints and favorable rulings from authorities, residents express deep disappointment over the government's inaction.
